Description of incident: An employee was charged with selling the personal identities of disabled hospital patients.  At least 22 military veterans who received services at the VA in Miami had their information sold.  The employee was worked at the VA Travel Benefits Sections and had access to the names, Social Security numbers, addresses, and dates of birth of disabled veterans who had been reimbursed for travel expenses related to their medical treatment.  The employee was caught late in 2010 after several veterans complained about unauthorized credit card accounts opened in their names.
